title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Showery weather condition is expected to enhance over Northern, North-central and Eastern provinces in next few days, today (13), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: SLC confirms Pakistan tour will continue despite players raising security concerns
byline: The Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) has reaffirmed that its ongoing tour of Pakistan will continue as scheduled, dismissing speculation of a pullout following a deadly suicide bombing in Islamabad that killed 12 and injured 27 on Tuesday.

title: Seven migrants rescued after Mediterranean shipwreck leaves 42 presumed dead
byline: Seven men have survived being lost at sea for six days after their dinghy capsized in the Mediterranean, with 42 people presumed dead, the International Organisation for Migration has said.

title: Ukraine ministers resign over major corruption scandals
byline: Ukraine’s energy and justice ministers resigned on Wednesday over their alleged involvement in a sweeping corruption scandal in the country’s energy sector.

title: Singer Akon arrested near Atlanta for missing court over suspended license
byline: Hip-hop artist Akon was arrested last week in suburban Atlanta after he didn’t show up in court to face a ticket for driving with a suspended license.

title: US President Trump signs govt funding bill, ending shutdown after a record 43-day disruption
byline: President Donald Trump signed a government funding bill Wednesday night, ending a record 43-day shutdown that caused financial stress for federal workers who went without paychecks, stranded scores of travelers at airports and generated long lines at some food banks.

title: Passenger bus plunges into a ravine in southern Peru killing at least 37
byline: A passenger bus fell into a deep ravine early Wednesday after crashing with another vehicle in southern Peru, killing at least 37 people and injuring 13 more, authorities said.

title: Police obtain 07-day detention order for Kirinda drug haul suspects
byline: The Tissamaharama Magistrate’s Court has granted permission to detain and interrogate the suspects arrested in connection with the Kirinda drug haul seizure for seven days.

title: Sri Lanka extends condolences over fatal military plane crash in Türkiye
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism Vijitha Herath has extended his condolences to the Government and people of Türkiye following the tragic military plane crash in Georgia.

title: Committee report on repeal of PTA submitted to Justice Minister
byline: President’s Counsel Rienzie Arsecularatne, chair of the committee appointed to review and make recommendations on the repeal of the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), has officially handed over the committee’s report and recommendations to Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayakkara.

title: Trump set to sign bill to end longest ever US shutdown after funding deal passes Congress
byline: The shutdown, which started on 1 October, has disrupted the lives of millions of Americans as all non-essential parts of government have been frozen.

title: Nugegoda rally on Nov. 21 to remind govt of its promises - Namal
byline: The public rally against the government, scheduled to be held in Nugegoda on November 21, is intended to remind the government of the promises it made to the people, says Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa.

title: Advocates for animal welfare urges govt. action on rising stray dog population
byline: The Animal Welfare Coalition (AWC) has raised concern over the rising number of dog bites in the country, citing a significant increase in the stray dog population.

title: Sheikh Hasina sets conditions for return to Bangladesh, accuses Yunus of degrading ties with India
byline: Ousted former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has said her return home hinges on the restoration of “participatory democracy”, lifting of the ban on the Awami League and the conduct of free, fair and inclusive elections.

title: Two associates of ‘Loku Patty’ arrested with cash and heroin
byline: The Aluthgama Police have arrested two associates of a notorious criminal known as ‘Loku Patty’, seizing Rs. 2.6 million in illicit cash, a stock of heroin, a motorcycle, and two mobile phones.

title: Arrest warrant issued for former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Lahiru Silva today issued a warrant for the arrest of the former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa for failure to appear before the court over an incident involving a false complaint.

title: Interim report on public service salary scheme to be submitted to Ministerial Committee
byline: An interim report prepared to establish a formal salary scheme for the public service will be presented to the Ministerial Consultative Committee on Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government, stated Member of Parliament Chandana Sooriyaarachchi, Chair of the Sub-Committee.

title: Sri Lankan crew remanded in Maldives until trial in record 350kg drug bust case
byline: The Criminal Court Wednesday (12) ordered the detention of five Sri Lankan men until the conclusion of their trial in connection with the seizure of 350 kilograms of illicit drugs from a Sri Lankan vessel intercepted in Maldivian waters last week.

title: Gold prices increase by Rs. 10,000 in Sri Lanka
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have risen following a significant increase in the price of gold in the world market.

title: One in five Sri Lankan adults suffer from diabetes - health officials
byline: Health authorities have revealed that one in five adults in Sri Lanka is currently living with diabetes, underscoring a growing public health concern in the country.

title: Revenue growth expected to slow down in 2026 due to decline in vehicle imports - Draft Report on Appropriation Bill
byline: The draft report prepared in accordance with Standing Order 121(5)(i) of Parliament regarding the Appropriation Bill for the Financial Year 2026 was considered at the meeting of the Committee on Public Finance (COPF).

title: FR petition seeks order to recover compensation paid to ex-Ministers and MPs for property damage
byline: The Supreme Court has fixed for consideration the fundamental rights (FR) petition filed seeking an order to recover the compensation “unlawfully” obtained by several former Ministers and Members of Parliament for their torched homes and properties during the violent incidents that occurred across the island on May 09, 2022.

title: Kuchchaveli PS Chairman’s bail application rejected
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has rejected the bail application filed by the Chairman of the Kuchchaveli Pradeshiya Sabha, Ainiya Pillai Mubarak of the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC), who was arrested on suspicion of accepting a bribe of Rs. 500,000.

title: Sri Lanka players to stay in Pakistan to continue tour, games move to Rawalpindi
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) has announced that the 16-member national cricket squad, along with the accompanying team management and support staff, will continue their tour of Pakistan.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces and districts today (13).

title: ‘Black Panther’ star Chadwick Boseman to receive Hollywood Walk of Fame star
byline: The late Chadwick Boseman is set to receive a posthumous star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

title: Delhi car blast: Terrorists planned big attacks on Dec. 6, say officials
byline: Indian government investigation into the horrific bomb blasts that took place near Delhi’s Red Fort on Monday evening revealed that doctors linked to the terror attack, including Dr Umar Nabi, the one who was driving the explosives-laden car, had planned to attack in multiple locations across Delhi and the NCR region on December 6.

title: Announcement on fertilizer subsidy for Maha season
byline: The Commissioner General of Agrarian Development, Dhammika Ranatunga, says that there is no reason for concerns regarding delays or non-receipt of the fertilizer subsidy for the ‘Maha’ cultivation season.

title: Five new foreign envoys present credentials to President Dissanayake
byline: Three newly appointed Ambassadors and two High Commissioners to Sri Lanka presented their credentials to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat this morning (13).

title: Pakistan deploys army to protect Sri Lankan cricketers
byline: Pakistan has deployed army and paramilitary forces to protect Sri Lanka’s cricket team after a deadly suicide bombing in Islamabad raised security concerns during their ongoing tour, the interior minister said on Thursday.

title: Two dead, 18 hurt in South Korea after truck crashes into market
byline: A light truck crashed into a market in South Korea on Thursday, ploughing 150 metres (164 yards) along a passageway lined with stalls before coming to a halt, killing two people and injuring 18, according to emergency officials and media reports.

title: Gabon court sentences former first lady and president’s son to 20 years in prison
byline: Gabon’s former first lady and her son were sentenced in absentia by a special criminal court to 20 years in prison following a two-day trial in Libreville.

title: President claims taxpayer money was previously used to fund extremism
byline: President of Sri Lanka, Anura Kumara Dissanayake, alleged that it was disclosed to him, during a discussion with intelligence officers, the manner in which public tax money had previously been spent to fund extremist elements.
